channel.title: [delta]Membership
channel.description:
Dear moparscapers,
I want to make a membership system. It will be that every month you will get -1 on your memberstatus(days) Now my question is: How can i make it that every 24h the membership variable will decrease by 1? You don't have to spoonfood me. Just push me in the right direction.
thanks in advance,
halflive9

item.title: [delta]Membership
item.dc:creator: @halflive9 halflive9
item.description:
@halflive9 wrote:

Thanks, i’ll try to figure out how te calendar works, if you got any tips please tell me.

Read full topic

item.title: [delta]Membership
item.dc:creator: @Coelho Coelho
item.description:
@Coelho wrote:

You could make a table in mysql (or file, mysql’s easier though) that has the rows,

(int 10) id, primary, auto-increment (varchar 32) username (bigint 12) timeout
And basically add the username to the table with the time (System.currentTimeMillis()) that they're membership will EXPIRE on (you can make an easy php script to do this for you). If they buy again and they're already in the database, simply add 31 days to the timeout.

Also, when you are checking for if someone has members,
run a query to delete all that have timed out first (“DELETE FROM character_members WHERE timeout > time()”),
and then check (SELECT * FROM character_members WHERE username = ‘USERNAME’).

This would be an actual decent way, opposed to all the other crap ways you could do it. Good luck!

Read full topic

item.title: [delta]Membership
item.dc:creator: @bryanc Bryanc
item.description:
@bryanc wrote:

Yeah get the current date and use the last date. Then just figure out the difference.

Another alternative would be to just set the date it ends (in the player save) and on each login check that date against with the current date. If it’s the same then they no longer have membership.

Read full topic

Read full topic

item.title: [delta]Membership
item.dc:creator: @bryanc Bryanc
item.description:
@bryanc wrote:

Well since it wouldn’t matter since they can’t see it anyways.

I would do it like this:

Instead of subtracting the amount of days left every single day, just do it when they login. To avoid subtracting twice on the same day… store the last date and on login subtract the last day from the current date. Now you have how many days you need to subtract for. If they have 0 days left, they don’t have membership status, if it’s 1 or more then they have that many days left.

Read full topic

item.title: [delta]Membership
item.dc:creator: @halflive9 halflive9
item.description:
@halflive9 wrote:

[quote=“eballer48, post:2, topic:413805”]Honestly have no idea.

BUT I know there’s several tuts out there for vote4cash and they have timers on them. Which is 24hrs because u can only vote every 24hrs. Sop rip the timer part and just add…

c.membership -= 1;
c.sendMessage(“You have “+c.membership+” days of membership left.”);
}

Now this is obviously PI code but you haw the basic idea hope it helps.[/quote]
Thank you. I hope this work, will check out tommorow.

Read full topic
